macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Markets Surge on Friday with Dow Topping 50,000
items.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average soared 1,206.95 points or 2.5% to 50,115.67, marking its first close above 50,000, while the S&P 500 rose 2% to 6,932.30 and Nasdaq gained 2.2% to 23,031.21, driven by tech recovery and positive consumer sentiment.

items.title: Weekly Performance Mixed as S&P 500 Dips Slightly, Dow Leads Gains
items.summary: For the week ending February 6, the Dow rose 2.5%, Russell 2000 up 2.2%, while S&P 500 fell 0.1% and Nasdaq dropped 1.8%, amid heightened volatility entering February.

items.title: Treasuries Rally on Weak Labor Data, Boosting Fed Easing Expectations
items.summary: US Treasuries rallied sharply this week, pushing yields to multi-month lows after weaker labor market data including rising job-cut announcements and unemployment claims, fueling expectations for further Federal Reserve policy easing.

items.title: US Stocks Rebound from AI Disruption Concerns, Tech Shares Lead
items.summary: US equities rebounded Friday as easing worries over AI-driven disruption lifted tech stocks, with S&P 500 up nearly 2%, Nasdaq advancing 2.2%, and chip stocks like Nvidia gaining on AI spending hopes.

items.title: January Jobs Report Delayed to February 11 Due to Government Shutdown
items.summary: The Bureau of Labor Statistics' January employment report, originally due Friday, is postponed to Wednesday, February 11, following a brief government shutdown that impacted data release.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: 'It sucks': Crypto gets a rude awakening to kick off Trump's second term
items.summary: Bitcoin has plunged nearly 50% from its October high, wiping out all gains since Trump's election and bottoming out at just over $60,000 on Thursday amid broader market concerns. The rout has led to crumbling stock prices for crypto-holding firms like Strategy and drawn political jabs from rivals like Gavin Newsom.

items.title: Bitcoin Fear and Greed Index Hits Rare Low
items.summary: The Bitcoin Fear and Greed Index has reached a rare low on February 7, 2026, similar to past instances that preceded temporary price rebounds, suggesting a potential pattern for monitoring.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Cerebras Systems Raises $1 Billion Series H at $23 Billion Valuation
items.summary: Cerebras Systems closed a $1 billion Series H funding round led by Tiger Global to scale its wafer-scale AI infrastructure for large AI workloads in on-prem and cloud deployments.[1]

items.title: Positron AI Secures $230 Million Series B Funding
items.summary: Positron AI raised $230 million at over $1 billion valuation to develop energy-efficient inference hardware, claiming up to 5x more tokens per watt than Nvidia’s Rubin GPU using Arm-based architecture.[1]

items.title: OpenAI Announces Breakthrough in Multimodal Reasoning
items.summary: OpenAI unveiled a new model that processes text, images, audio, and video simultaneously with human-like understanding, showing 40% improvement in multi-step reasoning tasks.[2]

items.title: LOGDIFF: New Framework for Logical Control in Diffusion Models
items.summary: Researchers introduced LOGDIFF, enabling diffusion models to generate images and proteins matching complex logical requirements via exact Boolean calculus for precise compositional guidance.[3]

items.title: NVIDIA Details Rubin Platform for 2026 AI Inference
items.summary: NVIDIA's Rubin (R100) architecture, slated for H2 2026 production, promises 10x reduction in cost-per-token for AI inference with Vera CPU and HBM4 memory, alongside Spectrum-X networking.[5]

items.title: AI Model Diagnoses Neurological Diseases from Brain MRIs in Seconds
items.summary: A new AI model analyzes brain MRI images in seconds to diagnose neurological diseases and triage urgent cases, advancing precision neuroimaging.[6]

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Baldur's Gate 3 Adaptation Announced with Craig Mazin as Writer and Producer
items.summary: Baldur's Gate 3 is being adapted into a television series, with The Last of Us showrunner Craig Mazin set to write, produce, and run the project.

items.title: Ubisoft Cancels Assassin's Creed League Multiplayer Title
items.summary: Ubisoft has cancelled Assassin's Creed League, a planned multiplayer game that was originally pitched as an expansion for Assassin's Creed Shadows. A small team will continue exploring how the concept can integrate with future AC titles.

items.title: Nvidia RTX 50-series Super and RTX 60-series Cards Delayed Due to RAM Shortage
items.summary: Nvidia has delayed both the RTX 50-series Super refresh and RTX 60-series graphics cards due to a global RAM shortage, as the company prioritizes AI projects over gaming hardware.

items.title: Star Trek Fleet Command Caught Using AI-Generated Marketing Content
items.summary: Publisher Scopely's Star Trek Fleet Command has been caught using AI-generated content in its marketing campaigns, with the publisher showing little concern about the controversy.

items.title: Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase Reveals Switch 2 Lineup
items.summary: The February 5th Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase announced numerous games for Switch and Switch 2, including Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection, Paranormasight: The Mermaid's Curse, and ports of major titles like Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth and Fallout 4: Anniversary Edition.

items.title: Mario Tennis Fever Releases February 12
items.summary: Nintendo's Mario Tennis Fever launches on February 12, continuing the series' tradition of arcade-style, character-driven sports gameplay with exaggerated mechanics and familiar Nintendo characters.

items.title: Roblox Forecasts Strong Fiscal 2026 Bookings Above Expectations
items.summary: Roblox has forecast fiscal 2026 bookings above Wall Street expectations, signaling continued strong growth in player spending and engagement on the gaming platform.

items.title: Microsoft Reportedly Expanding Xbox Game Pass in Early Stages
items.summary: Microsoft is in the early stages of expanding its Xbox Game Pass subscription service, following last year's overhaul of tiers, pricing, and perks.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Amazon Announces $200 Billion Capex Plan Amid Tech Sector Selloff
items.summary: Amazon revealed plans for $200 billion in capital expenditures this year, contributing to a combined $650 billion forecast from four major US tech companies. This announcement exacerbated a bruising week for tech stocks, including a $1 trillion software selloff and sharp declines in big tech shares despite solid revenue growth.
